name: Sandy Lane Hotel

reviews.text: We are here for our anniversary. We were here for our honeymoon. Sandy Lane is a diamond in the Carribean! The service is above any 5 star resort we ever visited. The food is comparable to NYC +. Housekeeping is impeccable! The staff is genuine , attentive and always pleasant and ready to serve you. The beds are like being on s cloud . Push a button and the drapes open, another and the lights go on. Devine!
reviews.title: Amazing and romantic! You are so spoiled being here! Literally, everything is at your fingertips.
Swimming with Hawksbill turtles at Sandy Lane Hotel Beach
reviews.text: I have 3 concerns though, one is that it is crazy expensive! A bottle of wine is above or much more than $80. ( Lots of taxes etc. added)The beach is lovely but the lounges are right next to one another. (Way to close) there is construction of a home for one of the owners. This begins at 720 am and goes til 6 PM. Too much noise for us but it should be completed in the next yr. ( it had been going now for 2 yrs:). )

Catamarans arrive each day around noon . They play loud music, drop the guests off to swim and walk the beach. I find this intrusive bc we pay a fortune and now we have all this noise and folks walking and snapping pictures.
reviews.title: Afternoon Tea at Sandy Lane Hotel Barbados

reviews.text: Overall I give Sandy Lane an A + . You will never receive attention or service as you do at Sandy Lane.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Awesome experience. We were fortunate to experience the privacy that we had when we went to the area. The Sandy Lane Beach in Barbados is where the Hawsbill turtles comes in to play so we saw a couple of turtles and swam with them. They were very friendly and fun. They swam around us and were not afraid when one of us touches them (we were not supposed to... except you just cannot resist!)
reviews.title: Still hard to find anything better then sandylane

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Sandy Lane in November to celebrate our Silver Wedding Anniversary and had a really wonderful time.
reviews.title: Exceptional and Pretty close to Perfect

reviews.text: The Sandy Lane 'experience' begins even before you arrive. I received an email from them via my Travel Agent with a questionnaire attached for my preferences for the drinks in the mini bar, the non alcholic ones being complimentary, and any other special requests such as dining reservations, spa appointments and island tours.
reviews.title: Elegance in the Caribbean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival at the airport we were whisked through security ( although I think this is a service arranged by our Travel Agent) and met by a representative of the hotel and escorted to our car.
reviews.title: Paradise
Afternoon Tea in the Tropics
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel and were shown to our room and were greeted to Etta James on the entertainment system singing "At Last" which really set the mood for our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What makes Sandy Lane so special is the attention to detail,which is the best I have experienced in a hotel anywhere. The staff really don't miss anything and the fabric is maintained to a very high standard. Our towels and even bathrobes were changed daily and new slippers were left each day. There were two days when curiously the maid did not leave us bathmats but there were so many towels we used those. We did ask for a kettle and a tea pot to be delivered to the room as the coffee maker did not boil the water hot enough for a decent cup of tea. The tea pot arrived within minutes but not the kettle. I suspect they don't have any and possibly deliberately for health and safety reasons so I can forgive them for that.
reviews.title: Barbados Bliss

reviews.text: I took my Wife and youngest son here back in 2009. Quite frankly an amazing hotel with great service. Beautifully equipped rooms and great food. Beach was a dream as was the service on the beach. You are made to feel very special whilst staying at the hotel even down to being assisted on arrival to the airport and personally being escorted through customs etc.
reviews.title: Very nice...

reviews.text: I passed through for two days principally to relax between business meetings in the region.
reviews.title: Perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was perfect for that, including the food (Acajoux), room (very quiet and comfortable with a garden view), service and spa. Didn't have time for golf but others raved about it, and a round was included in my package.
reviews.title: Close to perfection...will return again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's truly one of the world's great hotels up there with the Baur au Lac, des Bergues, Oriental, Okura, Amstel, etc. Very well managed in all respects. I tihnk this sets the high end standard in the entire region.
reviews.title: A wonderful honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sandy Lane deserves 5 stars not because it is perfect, but because it comes so darn close...and there aren't many hotels that do. From the plush rooms with so much attention to detail to ensure you have the comfort and space to feel at home to the exceptionally well trained staff, Sandy Lane has a lot to offer. It is situated on the Carribbean side of the island, which is important. We drove to the Atlantic Ocean side one day and while it was certainly an adventure and we enjoyed the "workout" battling the waves near the hotel that is often compared to Sandy Lane, it just doesn't compare...not even close. If you want to relax, be pampered, receive exceptional service and stay in a luxurious room with convenience at your fingertips with state-of-the-art touchpads for lighting/drapes, etc., stay at Sandy Lane. I will caution you: you will pay dearly for those comforts. Hotel and food is pricey, but we must feel it is worth it because we will be back...again.
reviews.title: Pretty amazing place

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 weeks. It is expensive but you get the service you expect with the price tag.
reviews.title: Beautiful place, friendly staff & kid friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sometimes too much - they check in on you a lot so be sure to put up your Do Not Disturb if you don't want to be bothered.
reviews.title: The best I've been to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its not a huge hotel, you can walk from one side of the resort to the other in less than 5 minutes.
reviews.title: Cant compare to resorts in Hawaii

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is super friendly and we spent many afternoons having lunch by the beach.
reviews.title: Best ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you can get a room on the bottom floor in the dolphin wing I highly suggest it - you can just open your back door and take a short walk to the beach.
reviews.title: By far and away exceeds the experience of 2nd best hotel I've ever stayed in

description: Elegant and exclusive, Sandy Lane is set in an ancient mahogany grove overlooking a 1000 foot crescent of gorgeous white sand beach. Accommodations include 112 rooms and suites as well as a stunning 5-bedroom villa. With a magnificent 47,000-square-foot spa, four restaurants, six bars, nine floodlit tennis courses, beachside service, 45 holes of championship golf and The Treehouse Club facility for kids and teens, Sandy Lane will cater to your every need.
